Ad Text:
ABOUT US

Outline Global is reshaping how regulated industries manage compliance and environmental performance. We deliver premium imagery, LiDAR, and AI‑driven insights that help organisations operate more efficiently, sustainably and transparently.

We are entering a new growth phase, moving from mostly project-based work to long-term partnerships and delivery programs with some of Australia’s largest enterprises. This is your chance to be part of that journey.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking an experienced LiDAR specialist to join our dynamic team undertaking our end-to-end LiDAR processing, quality assurance and delivery workflows. This role is critical to ensuring that our national airborne survey programs deliver consistently accurate, high-quality datasets aligned to Australian and international standards.

Melbourne location preferred, will accept applications Australia-wide.

Key Responsibilities

•  Undertake LiDAR processing workflows from raw data ingest to final classified outputs and derived products.

• Ensuring classification standards are met (e.g., ICSM, client-specific specifications).

• Manage and refine QA/QC processes, ensuring precision, consistency and compliance across all datasets.

• Conduct technical reviews of point clouds, intensity data, trajectory files, and calibration/boresight results.

• Work with internal technical teams to optimise processing pipelines, automation, and performance.

• Maintain governance over Ground Control Points (GCPs), checkpoints, and associated metadata.

• Implementation of best practices for LiDAR data management, large dataset handling and data integrity (e.g., managing terabyte-scale LiDAR datasets, version control, and backups).

•  Collaborate with survey partners to ensure capture quality aligns with survey best practices and project requirements.

• Provide expert advice on flight planning impacts, sensor capability, accuracy thresholds, and project feasibility.

•  Contribute to continuous improvement and R&D initiatives across LiDAR, AI/ML, and automated workflows.

 

ABOUT YOU

Skills & Experience

Essential

•  Minimum 3+ years' experience in LiDAR processing, classification, and QC.

•  Strong understanding of Australian survey standards, ICSM/ANZLIC specifications, and category classifications.

•  Proven ability to interpret and manage survey-grade LiDAR data, including:

o   Trajectory processing

o   Strip alignment and boresight adjustments

o   Point cloud calibration

o   Noise filtering and classification modelling

o   Hydro-flattening and breakline integration for topographic LiDAR workflows.

•  Accuracy reporting and compliance documentation (producing QA reports, accuracy summaries, and metadata for clients).

• Solid knowledge of ground survey practices, including GCP/GPS survey quality, budgets, and metadata requirements.

•  Demonstrated experience ensuring GCP governance and traceability from field collection to final accuracy reporting.

•  Advanced capability with LiDAR software (e.g. TerraScan, LAStools, Global Mapper, stripalign, RiPROCESS, POSPac).

•  Exceptional attention to detail with a continuous improvement mindset.

•  Strong communication skills for cross-team coordination and client engagement.

•  Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects in a fast-paced environment.

Desirable

•  Experience with AI/ML-driven classification or automated QC workflows.

•  Experience in aerial survey operations and planning.

•  Knowledge of Australian vertical datums and geodetic frameworks (AHD, AUSGeoid, GDA2020, ellipsoidal heights).

•  Experience with PDAL and ability to script in Python or similar for workflow automation.

We are looking for a self-motivated team player with a strong desire to learn, share knowledge and contribute to the growth of Outline Global. We value people who can both work independently and successfully collaborate with others to deliver results.  

This role offers a degree of workplace flexibility in terms of a combination of working between home and the office.

Location: Canberra, ACT (CBD). Flexible work arrangements available.
Job title: EL1 Data Scientist (Senior Data Scientist)
Rate: $81.81 to $89.84 per hour, plus super (37.5 hours per week)
Contract: 12 months, with extension option up to 6 months
Start date: Early to mid February 2026

About Us
Canberra Consulting delivers highly skilled professionals to Government and Defence clients. We back our consultants with clear briefs, responsive communication, and a practical, high-trust approach that helps you do your best work.

The Opportunity
We are seeking an EL1-level Data Scientist for a Canberra based Australian Government engagement. You will partner with business and technical stakeholders to define problems, source and prepare data, build and validate models, and translate complex analysis into decision-ready recommendations. This role is suited to someone who is hands-on with modelling, confident communicating with non-technical stakeholders, and comfortable operating in a governed environment where quality, transparency, privacy, and security obligations matter. You will also contribute to capability uplift through knowledge sharing and coaching, helping build stronger analytics practice across the team.

Key Responsibilities
Apply advanced data mining, machine learning, and statistical techniques to structured and unstructured data.
Build, validate, and deploy predictive and explanatory models to address business problems and inform decision making.
Provide insights into drivers of business performance and influence priorities through evidence-based recommendations.
Engage business areas to understand requirements and translate complex analytical concepts into clear, actionable outputs.
Assess and select modelling techniques and data sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and security across the analytics lifecycle.
Present technical and non-technical information clearly and concisely, tailored to stakeholder needs.
Develop dashboards and visualisations using tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Lead small teams or work streams, manage competing priorities, and deliver analytics work to agreed timeframes and standards.
Drive capability uplift through knowledge sharing and coaching.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of models, processes, and findings to support reproducibility and transparency.
Skills and Experience Technical capabilities

Demonstrated experience in data science, analytics, and statistical modelling, including machine learning and data mining.
Proficiency in Python or R, and experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong data management capability, including data sourcing, cleaning, transformation, and integration.
Understanding of data governance, privacy, and security obligations in an Australian Government context.
Strong documentation discipline to support auditability, repeatability, and defensibility of analysis.
Behavioural capabilities

Excellent written and verbal communication, including the ability to present complex information to a range of audiences.
Proven ability to manage competing priorities and deliver high-quality outcomes under tight timeframes.
Experience leading small teams or project streams, and working collaboratively across business areas.
Practical, outcome-focused mindset and the ability to build productive relationships quickly.
Security Clearance
You must be an Australian Citizen and hold a minimum Baseline security clearance. Successful candidates may also be required to obtain an ACIC organisational suitability assessment.

Senior AI Engineer – Build Enterprise-Scale Agentic Systems

Sydney OR Melbourne

$1000 Per Day (Including Super)

This business is building a full enterprise platform to power agentic automation across every function of the organisation. You’ll join a newly formed engineering unit tasked with building the foundations: enterprise agents, reasoning systems, knowledge graph integration, and the underlying cloud-native platform.

This is greenfield, high-impact engineering where your work becomes the backbone of large-scale automation across thousands of users.

What you’ll work on You’ll be building the core capabilities needed for an enterprise to operate AI-first:

Ingesting large codebases and systems so agents can reason, plan, and take action
Building scalable backend services and AI pipelines in Python, Java, and GCP
Integrating with Vertex AI, orchestration tools, and knowledge graph services
Shaping the architecture for a unified platform that future AI products will be built on
Shipping production-quality engineering that supports mission-critical operations
What you bring We’re looking for engineers who can operate at a senior level across software, AI systems, and cloud fundamentals:

Core Engineering (Need to have)
5+ years software engineering (Python preferred; Java welcome)
Strong SDLC experience, building and supporting production systems
Experience with CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud-native design (GCP ideal)
Experience with Google ADK, Neo4j, or other graph-based systems
Ability to work across ingestion, orchestration, and platform components
AI & Agentic Systems
Experience building or integrating LLM-powered systems
Hands-on experience with agentic frameworks (LangChain, LangGraph, LlamaIndex, ADK, similar)
Ability to design and implement RAG, vector search, and retrieval patterns
Understanding of LLMOps, model deployment, monitoring, and experimentation

Meet the AI Free Thinking Paralegal team

AI Free Thinking Paralegal is a new team, operating at the cutting edge of AI technology within ATI Global - one of the largest international LegalTech companies. Led by the previous technology co-founder of CreditorWatch and Avenue Bank, we combine high autonomy, high flexibility, and low bureaucracy like a startup, while enjoying the peace of mind and stability that come with being part of a mature, successful organisation. Working side-by-side with an experienced technology leader (a coder and entrepreneur), you will work on a variety of interesting challenges as we build the future of AI-powered legal assistance.

This is an exciting opportunity to make a powerful impact by revolutionising how lawyers work with AI, enabling them to analyse complex legal matters, prepare accurate documents, and deliver better outcomes for their clients.

What you'll do

We’re hiring two Software Engineers to help to shape the backbone of a groundbreaking AI platform that’s redefining how legal professionals interact with technology. You’ll work alongside experts in AI, automation, and legal innovation to solve problems few have faced before, helping to build the AI Free Thinking Paralegal - the future of AI-powered productivity at LEAP. As part of our team developing the agentic AI core platform that consumes Model Context Protocol (MCP) services, you’ll design and scale the infrastructure connecting automation, integrations, and generative AI across LEAP and the wider ATI Group. Expect to push the boundaries of what’s possible - creating advanced automation frameworks, integrating generative AI, and building scalable systems that transform how legal work gets done.

To make this happen, you will:

Design, build, and maintain core services that consume and orchestrate MCP-based integrations.
Develop scalable, reliable, and secure systems to support automation and generative AI workflows.
Collaborate closely with teams developing MCP services to ensure smooth integration and performance.
Solve complex engineering problems around AI reliability, context management, and data flow.
Prototype and optimise AI-driven features that work within known limitations of generative models.
Participate in architectural planning, service design, and API definition.
Continuously improve system robustness, observability, and developer experience.

What you'll bring

Over 7 years commercial experience as a developer
Strong experience in at least two of the following:
PHP/Laravel
Python
TypeScript/JavaScript/React
Solid understanding of automation, system integrations, or AI-enabled workflows.
Demonstrated ability to work with LLMs or generative AI systems - understanding their constraints, strengths, and how to build around their limitations.
Experience designing and consuming APIs, ideally in distributed environments.
Strong debugging and problem-solving skills, with a creative mindset for building robust, maintainable systems.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills - able to translate technical concepts into clear, actionable ideas.

Even better, if you:

Experience with MCP, Kafka, N8N, Zapier, or other inter-application communication frameworks and event-driven systems.
Background in AI safety, prompt engineering, or agent-based system design.
Contributions to open-source AI or integration frameworks.

You are the type of person who

Loves bringing creativity and innovation to every problem you solve
Gets things done by transforming prototypes into production-ready solutions through progressive iteration and refinement
Takes pride in your team's work and celebrates collective achievements
Thrives on solving difficult, complex problems that push the boundaries of what's possible
Values working autonomously while actively contributing to the team's success
Believes that you succeed when the whole team succeeds - collaboration and shared wins drive you forward

AI Free Thinking Paralegal is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

Why join AI Free Thinking Paralegal

Your work matters. Helping lawyers help people sits at the heart of everything we do. We solve real world problems that improve and support local, everyday law firms. So they can do their best work for the people in the communities they serve.
Make an impact. You won’t be another ‘cog in the wheel’ here. We give full trust and autonomy for you to be heard, to work on big & complex projects – and to make a real difference.
Work with a group of authentic, passionate people who love what they do.
Well-funded and global. We're part of ATI – one of the largest international LegalTech companies.
Flexible and hybrid working. We'd like to find this person in Sydney, but we want you to work in a way that suits you and we're open to flexible arrangements that support you.
Grow your career with us. Our founder Christian Beck has been building legal tech businesses for over 30 years. There are opportunities galore to expand your career based on where your interests lie. We're not afraid to pivot based on market conditions - you will always have the opportunity to stay ahead of the curve and do your best work here.
Have fun with us. Celebrations. Socials. Sports teams. Access to sailing and yacht events.
We value your well-being - enjoy an additional paid wellbeing day every year, free gym membership, corporate dental plan and weekly massages in the office. We'll throw in a catered lunch and breakfast every week too. Oh and an on-site barista.
Access to LEAP Home - a program unique to LEAP to support you in buying your primary residence.

Job Title: Data Engineers – Multiple Consultancies - Sydney & Melbourne
Ad Text:
I'm currently partnering with several leading consultancies that are building out their Data & AI capability for 2026 project pipelines across financial services, utilities, retail, and emerging AI programs.

We’re looking to connect with high-calibre Data Engineers who thrive in modern cloud environments and enjoy building scalable, production-ready data solutions.

What you’ll work on: Across these consultancies, projects typically include:

Designing and implementing scalable cloud data platforms
Building and optimising ETL / ELT pipelines (Python + SQL heavy)
Migrating data workloads into cloud warehouses (Snowflake, Databricks, BigQuery, Redshift)
Supporting analytics & BI platforms
Developing cloud-based applications & automation frameworks
Improving existing data systems using modern engineering practices
Delivering clear technical documentation and supporting platform operations
What we’re looking for:
3+ years’ experience in Data Engineering or Software Engineering
Strong Python and SQL fundamentals
Hands-on experience across modern cloud platforms (AWS / Azure / GCP)
Background in building data models, pipelines, and performance optimisation
Exposure to Snowflake, Databricks, BigQuery or similar platforms
Strong communication skills and the ability to work with cross-functional teams
Why connect now? These consultancies are forecasting significant Data & AI capability uplift in 2026, and I’m building early shortlists ahead of confirmed project kick-offs.

If you’re open to permanent work, and want to align yourself with high-quality project environments, let's speak.

About Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


About the Role:

We are seeking a Designer Specialist (Drafter) to support complex engineering programs across the Lockheed Martin Australia portfolio. This role contributes to the development of bespoke assemblies, equipment layouts, schematics and engineering drawings, working closely with Integrated Product Teams across defence domains. 

You will also be the enterprise owner and technical authority for PTC Creo, leading its development, governance and integration with the broader digital engineering toolset. This is a key role in advancing LMA’s digital thread and model-focused design maturity, setting consistent, best-practice modelling standards across the organisation. 

Key Responsibilities:

Lead and review physical designs while mentoring and guiding junior designers

Collaborate with Engineering Managers and Product Leaders on physical integration and design maturity

Develop interface definitions, layouts, schematics, cable schedules and CDRL-compliant drawings

Own and govern LMA’s use of Creo, defining configuration, standards and best-practice usage

Provide expert guidance for complex or non-standard modelling challenges

Drive continuous improvement of Creo through automation, PLM/MBSE integration and model-driven design

Establish and enforce enterprise-wide modelling standards aligned to the digital thread

Support transition of design data to production (Stage 3)

 

About You:

You are an experienced CAD professional with a strong foundation in mechanical and electromechanical design, who enjoys working at scale and influencing how design is done across an organisation.

You bring:

Significant experience using 3D CAD tools, preferably PTC Creo Parametric

Strong background in concept and detailed design of mechanical and electromechanical assemblies

Experience developing and managing large CAD assemblies

Proven drafting experience with Australian and international standards

Experience working within Defence or complex engineering programs

Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative, solution-focused mindset

An active NV-1 security clearance and ability to handle Export Controlled information 




How We Reward and Support You:

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else and are supported with a range of benefits to suit different life stages, including flexible and hybrid work options, discounts and cashback programs, a variety of leave options including Purchase Leave, and additional wellbeing programs such as annual flu vaccinations, novated leasing, and fitness initiatives.


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and values diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, free of unlawful discrimination and is harassment free, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. By leveraging our employees' unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

As part of our endeavours to increase participation of Indigenous Australians, we welcome applications from all people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

Advanced Navigation - It's In The Name

Advanced Navigation is a global leader in APNT and autonomous system technologies. By leveraging capabilities in software-defined hardware, every solution delivers unrivaled capabilities and exceptional performance across land, air, sea and space applications where GPS is unreliable. 




Made possible with extensive research, testing and vertically integrated manufacturing, the company has progressed into deep technology fields, including robotics, inertial, photonic and quantum sensing, artificial intelligence, underwater acoustics, and GPS antennas and receivers. Customers choose Advanced Navigation for rapid product delivery and unmatched technical field expertise.




Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, with research and production facilities nationwide and offices globally. Backed by KKR, In-Q-Tel (IQT), former Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull and  General David H. Petraeus (US Army, Ret.), Advanced Navigation supports AUKUS by collaborating with UK and US partners to drive innovation, fortify supply chains, and enhance allied resilience and interoperability in defense. #JoinTheAutonomyRevolution




About the role

In this role you will be a subject matter expert, filling a critical knowledge gap in your engineering team. Given that our company heavily relies on software to enhance hardware performance, this person must have a strong multidisciplinary background across physics, electronics, and software.

The ideal candidate would have a unique blend of hands-on testing experience and a deep theoretical understanding of sensor technologies. Your background should bridge the gap between our software, mechanical, and electronic engineering teams.


What you'll do

Contribute to the research and development of novel, internally-developed sensor technologies.

Provide expert guidance to the engineering team on the critical properties of sensors for inertial navigation systems.

Develop and implement advanced sensor calibration techniques to optimise system performance.

Lead the testing, characterisation, and selection of third-party inertial sensors.

Analyse test data to identify sensor performance limitations and areas for improvement.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate sensors into our diverse product range, from low-cost to high-end systems.

Qualifications

Sensor Testing and Characterisation: They must have proven experience in designing and executing tests for inertial sensors (accelerometers and gyroscopes). This includes understanding test methodologies, sources of error, and how to analyse the resulting data.

Sensor Development: Experience in the development of new sensors is crucial. This could involve technologies like MEMS (Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems), FOG (Fibre-Optic Gyroscopes), or other emerging sensor tech. This experience ensures they can contribute to your in-house sensor development.

Inertial Navigation Systems (INS) Expertise: A deep understanding of how sensor characteristics impact the performance of an INS is paramount. They should be able to identify which sensor properties are most critical for your high-performance navigation systems.

Calibration Techniques: The candidate should be proficient in advanced sensor calibration methods to minimise errors and optimise performance.

Software and Data Analysis Skills: Proficiency in software tools used for data acquisition and analysis, such as Python or MATLAB, is important.
Industry Experience: While not mandatory, experience in one of our key industries—like defense, maritime, or autonomous vehicles—would be a significant plus

Educational Background: A degree in a relevant field such as Physics, Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering, or a closely related discipline is essential. An advanced degree (Master's or PhD) would be highly advantageous, especially if their research was focused on sensor technology or inertial navigation. Australian citizens are desirable for security reasons, ADF experience is highly regarded and Veterans are encouraged to apply

Job Title: Senior Data Engineer - Sydney or Canberra
Ad Text:
THE OPPORTUNITY

Australian-owned, Award-winning, and ASX listed, Viva Leisure are Australia’s second-largest and fastest-growing operator of health and fitness experiences and facilities.  Viva Leisure operates in all segments of health and fitness and our range of offerings includes big-box health clubs, express gyms, high-intensity group training studios, pilates, yoga, aquatics, women's only facilities, personal training and more.

Viva Leisure have the mission of connecting health and wellness to as many people as possible through our range of awesome, affordable and accessible facilities.  Our vision is to be the #1 in the industry for our employees, our shareholders, our franchisees, our communities, and of course our members.

As the founding Senior Data Engineer for Viva 360, you’ll design and build the data and AI backbone of Viva Leisure’s new analytics platform. This hands-on role focuses on developing scalable data pipelines, machine learning infrastructure, and decision engines that transform raw data into real-time, predictive insights driving member retention, acquisition, and personalisation.

You’ll architect and operationalise production-grade systems, implement data governance, and integrate ML models into core business functions. This is a rare opportunity to shape the future of data and AI in the fitness industry — with autonomy to make key technical decisions, direct visibility to leadership, and the chance to expand the platform’s impact across brands and use cases.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

ML Pipeline Engineering (40%)

Design and deliver production-grade ML pipelines to support churn prediction and member acquisition models.
Develop and maintain feature stores for reusable member attributes across multiple use cases.
Build model training, versioning, and deployment workflows using MLflow and other MLOps tools.
Create and manage model serving endpoints to enable real-time inference at scale.
Engineer decision engine pipelines that automate marketing interventions and member engagement.
Design rule-based and ML-driven decisioning workflows to optimise business outcomes.

Data Infrastructure (35%)

Build scalable ETL/ELT pipelines ingesting data from 500+ locations and multiple external platforms.
Implement Databricks lakehouse architecture with Delta Lake for unified storage and processing.
Configure and optimise cloud compute resources for both batch and streaming data workloads.
Design data models optimised for analytics, reporting, and ML feature extraction.

Data Quality & Governance (15%)

Implement Unity Catalog governance with fine-grained (row-level) security across 11 brands.
Build automated data quality checks and validation processes into pipelines.
Develop audit trails and lineage tracking for compliance with member PII regulations.
Manage schema evolution and ensure resilience for downstream consumers.

Operations & Optimisation (10%)

Monitor pipeline performance, ML model inference latency, and overall system reliability.
Automate workflows using orchestration tools such as Airflow or Data Factory.
Establish robust alerting frameworks for data freshness, pipeline failures, and model performance degradation.
Maintain clear documentation of architecture, pipelines, workflows, and runbooks to ensure knowledge continuity.
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE 

We are looking for someone with:

Education and Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
Postgraduate qualifications in data engineering, data science, or cloud technologies desirable.
Professional certifications in AWS, Azure, or GCP (Data Engineer focus) highly regarded.

Skills and Experience

7+ years’ experience building and maintaining production-grade data platforms and ML pipelines.
Expert in Python (PySpark, pandas) and SQL for data engineering, modelling, and optimisation.
Proven experience with cloud-based data services (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Skilled in designing data lakehouse architectures, governance frameworks, and scalable ETL/ELT workflows (Airflow, Data Factory, etc.).
Strong understanding of dimensional modelling and ML lifecycle management, including deployment, versioning, and monitoring.
Proficient with Git for version control and collaborative development.
Familiarity with MLflow, Kafka/Kinesis/Event Hubs, and BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker) desirable.
Experience working in multi-tenant, regulated data environments handling PII and compliance requirements.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with a proactive, ownership-driven mindset.
Bonus: Experience in fitness, leisure, or subscription-based industries, and knowledge of Australian data privacy standards.
YOUR LIFE AT VIVA - PERKS & BENEFITS

As an employer of choice, Viva prides itself on supporting you in the best way possible by providing a range of incentives that meet the everyday needs of our people. We offer a range of benefits to our employees such as Flexible Work Arrangements and great work-life balance for personal rejuvenation and well-being, Free Fitness Membership, Central locations with brand new facilities and office kitchens fully stocked with Complimentary Meals, drinks and snacks, Paid Parental Leave, ongoing Learning and Development opportunities and access to a Virtual Medical Practice offering GP consultations, dietitian support, psychology services and health coaching. With countless career paths under one roof, the possibilities are endless.

Above all, Viva is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where every background, perspective, gender, and identity is celebrated. We believe in empowering everyone to be themselves, knowing that it's when we embrace our differences that we perform at our best.

We make every opportunity last at Viva and are looking to find members of the team to upskill and develop all with the aim to make Viva the best place to work.

ABOUT VIVA LEISURE

At Viva Leisure, our mission is simple: to connect health and wellness to as many people as possible through our awesome, affordable, and accessible facilities. Our vision is to be the number one in the industry — benefitting our members, shareholders, franchisees, communities, and employees alike.

As an Australian-owned and ASX-listed company, we offer a diverse range of health and fitness solutions, including big-box health clubs, express gyms, high-intensity group training studios, Pilates, yoga, aquatics, women’s-only facilities, personal training, and more. Established in 2004, our key brands include Club Lime, hiit republic, Plus Fitness, GROUNDUP, and Rebalance. With over 300 facilities across Australia and internationally, including corporate-owned and franchised sites, we’re proud to serve diverse communities.

In 2020, Viva Leisure acquired Chain Collective Group to expand our fitness franchise brands both domestically and internationally. Chain Collective now operates as the franchising arm of Viva Leisure, proudly holding Plus Fitness as its flagship franchised brand — paving the way for the continued growth and success of multiple fitness concepts across Australia and beyond.

In 2024, Viva Leisure acquired a 34% stake in Boutique Fitness Studios (BFS), the master franchisee for leading global brands including Club Pilates, Rumble Boxing, StretchLab, and CycleBar. This partnership marks an exciting new chapter as Viva’s Rebalance Pilates & Yoga studios transition to Club Pilates, uniting local expertise with world-class brand standards to deliver a premium member experience. That same year, Viva Leisure also acquired a 25% equity stake in World Gym Australia, along with three corporate-owned World Gym locations in Queensland — Stafford, Coomera, and Underwood — further strengthening our presence in the premium fitness sector.

ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

Viva Leisure acknowledges and pays respects to the Traditional Owners of Country throughout Australia, including Elders past and present. We are committed to protecting children, young, and vulnerable people from harm, and the successful candidate/s will be required to hold and maintain an appropriate clearance to work with Children. Please note that Viva reserves the right to pull the advert before the end date if a suitable applicant is found before the close date. Additionally, Viva is committed to building an inclusive culture where diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and identities are celebrated. We believe in empowering everyone to be themselves, as we know that it's when we embrace our differences that we perform at our best, enabling our future success.
